div.p: Acc to Jaini, Padmanabh S. (in “Bodhisattva Career of the Tathāgata Maitreya”):
Mahāvastu talks of 4 stages in a bsv’s career:
Edgerton catvārīmāni bodhisattvānāM bodhisattvacaryāṇi Mv i.1.2

item.p: prakṛticaryā (“natural career”) – cultivates roots of merit
pranidhānacaryā (“resolving stage”) – vows to attain enlightenment in the presence of a buddha who prophesies (vyākaraṇa) his future buddhahood and he is then designated a bsv.
anulomacaryā (“conforming stage”) – bsv approaches the goal through the bhūmis by fulfilling the 10 pāramitā.

anivartanacaryā (Edgerton = avi-) (“preserving career”) – irreversibly destined (niyata) for buddhahood, and will be anointed (abhiṣeka) by a Buddha as his immediate successor and will be reborn in Tuṣita, then reincarnates in final birth to become a tathāgata and attains parinirvāṇa at the end of his life.

div.bibl: Jaini, Padmanabh S., “Stages in the Bodhisattva Career of the Tathāgata Maitreya,” in Sponberg and Hardacre (eds.), Maitreya, the Future Buddha, pp 54-90. Cambridge, 1988: Cambridge University Press. Reprinted with additional material in Jaini, Padmanabh S., Collected Papers on Buddhist Studies, Ch. 26. Delhi, 2001: Motilal Banarsidass.
